key_insight: LMSF-A uses a lightweight multi-scale attention design to deliver accurate instance segmentation in spinal endoscopy while meeting strict real-time and low-hardware constraints; it is robust to small-batch training and challenging visual artifacts.
problem_solved: Enables reliable, real-time instance segmentation in spinal endoscopy despite narrow FOV, specular highlights, smoke/bleeding, unclear boundaries, large scale variation, and limited surgical hardware and batch-size constraints.
method: Multi-scale attention module that fuses features across resolutions to handle large object scale changes and unclear boundaries.
Lightweight backbone and efficient segmentation heads optimized for low latency and deployment on constrained surgical hardware.
Training and architectural choices that maintain stability and accuracy under small-batch (including batch-1) regimes and adverse visual artifacts.
impact: Makes instance segmentation practical for intraoperative use by balancing accuracy, robustness, and real-time performance on limited hardware; useful reference for ML practitioners building efficient, robust medical vision models.
visual_elements: Compact architecture diagram showing backbone → multi-scale attention fusion → lightweight instance heads
Before/after overlays on endoscopic frames highlighting improved boundary and small-object detection under smoke/specular conditions
Speed vs. accuracy chart comparing LMSF-A to heavier baselines (FPS on target hardware vs. mAP/IoU)
Attention heatmaps at multiple scales to illustrate how the model focuses on critical anatomy across resolutions
paper_title: A Lightweight Multi-Scale Attention Framework for Real-Time Spinal Endoscopic Instance Segmentation
paper_authors: Qi Lai, JunYan Li, Qiang Cai, Lei Wang, Tao Yan
